perturbation.original_text: Subject to Distributor's performance of its obligations under this Agreement, Distributor is appointed as a NETGEAR Distributor and may purchase certain equipment ("Hardware") and licenses for software including revisions and updates ("Software"), as are listed in NETGEAR's then-current price list (the "Price List") for resale within the Territory (as defined below). During the initial one (1) year term of this Agreement. Distributor shall be the only distributor appointed by NETGEAR in the Territory, subject to Distributor conducting mutually agreed to marketing activities as described in the Marketing Plan to be developed and agreed to by and between the parties and which shall be attached to and made a part of this Agreement as Exhibit 4. For the purposes of this provision, distributor shall mean a company acquiring products directly from NETGEAR for resale or license to dealers or other second tier resellers which in turn resell or license the products to end use customers. The foregoing notwithstanding, during the initial one (1) year term and any subsequent period. NETGEAR reserves the right to sell or license Products in the Territory to customers other than distributors such as, but not limited to resellers who procure Products at centralized locations for resale to end-use customers solely through their wholly or majority owned retail outlets, both store-front and catalog. Following the initial one (1) year term, for any extension or renewal term, Distributor's appointment as Distributor shall be non-exclusive and NETGEAR may appoint other distributors in the Territory at its sole discretion.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to Distributor's performance of its obligations under this Agreement, Distributor is appointed as a NETGEAR Distributor and may purchase certain equipment ("Hardware") and licenses for software including revisions and updates ("Software"), as are listed in NETGEAR's then-current price list (the "Price List") for resale within the Territory (as defined below). During the initial one (1) year term of this Agreement. Distributor shall be the only distributor appointed by NETGEAR in the Territory, subject to Distributor conducting mutually agreed to marketing activities as described in the Marketing Plan to be developed and agreed to by and between the parties and which shall be attached to and made a part of this Agreement as Exhibit 4. For the purposes of this provision, distributor shall mean a company acquiring products directly from NETGEAR for resale or license to dealers or other second tier resellers which in turn resell or license the products to end use customers. The foregoing notwithstanding, during the initial one (1) year term and any subsequent period. NETGEAR reserves the right to sell or license Products in the Territory to any customers. Following the initial one (1) year term, for any extension or renewal term, Distributor's appointment as Distributor shall be non-exclusive and NETGEAR may appoint other distributors in the Territory at its sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states NETGEAR reserves the right to sell or license Products in the Territory to customers other than distributors such as resellers who procure Products at centralized locations for resale to end-use customers solely through their wholly or majority owned retail outlets, both store-front and catalog. The changed text says NETGEAR reserves the right to sell or license Products in the Territory to any customers. This creates an ambiguity as the first definition limits the types of customers NETGEAR can sell to, whereas the new definition says NETGEAR can sell to any customers.

perturbation.original_text: NETGEAR warrants to end-user that each item of Hardware will be free from defects in workmanship and materials for its respective warranty period which begins on the date of purchase by the end user. Should a Product fail within this warranty period, Distributor shall replace such defective Product from Distributor's inventory and accept return of the failed Product from Distributor's customer. At intervals to be mutually agreed upon between NETGEAR and Distributor. Distributor shall contact NETGEAR to receive a Return Material Authorization number for the collected failed Product. Upon receipt of the failed Product, NETGEAR shall issue a credit to Distributor for Distributor's purchase price of the replacement Product issued, less any prior credits or allowances. End-users' exclusive remedy is to receive replacement Product from reseller and NETGEAR's sole obligation and liability under this warranty is to issue an off-setting credit to reseller for Product returned by reseller on behalf of its end-user because of defects in workmanship or material.
perturbation.changed_text: NETGEAR warrants to end-user that each item of Hardware will be free from defects in workmanship and materials for its respective warranty period which begins on the date of purchase by the end user. Should a Product fail within this warranty period, the End-user must directly contact NETGEAR to receive a Return Material Authorization number for the collected failed Product. Upon receipt of the failed Product, NETGEAR shall either repair or replace the failed Product. End-users' exclusive remedy is to directly receive replacement Product from NETGEAR and NETGEAR's sole obligation and liability under this warranty is to repair or replace the Product directly for the End-User.
perturbation.explanation: In section 7.B, NETGEAR's obligation is to issue an off-setting credit to reseller. However, in the modified text, NETGEAR's obligation and liability is to repair or replace the Product directly for the End-User. It's now unclear whether the Distributor or the end-user would be the point of contact.

perturbation.original_text: Prior to returning any Product, whether for exchange or warranty or non-warranty action, Distributor must obtain a Return Materials Authorization (RMA) number from NETGEAR. Distributor should return the product to NETGEAR, [*]. NETGEAR will not accept collect shipments. Any Product returned to NETGEAR, which is not returned in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, may be rejected.
perturbation.changed_text: Prior to returning any Product, whether for exchange or for warranty action, Distributor is not required to obtain a Return Materials Authorization (RMA) number from NETGEAR. Distributor can return the product to NETGEAR, [*]. NETGEAR will only accept collect shipments. Any Product returned to NETGEAR, which is not returned in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, can be accepted.
perturbation.explanation: In the original section 8, Distributor must obtain a Return Materials Authorization (RMA) number from NETGEAR and NETGEAR will not accept collect shipments. Whereas in the changed text, Distributor is not required to obtain a Return Materials Authorization (RMA) number from NETGEAR and NETGEAR will only accept collect shipments. It's now uncertain whether the Distributor has to get an RMA and how to ship.
